page_content: Profile: Dr. Nisha Tiwari. Role: Assistant Professor  (French). Bio: Dr. Nisha Tiwari is an Assistant Professor of French at the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT-Deemed to be University, where she also serves as the Academic and IQAC Coordinator. Prior to this, she spent over three years as an Assistant Professor and Language Coordinator at Amity University, Haryana, where she played a key role in curriculum development, particularly in alignment with the NEP 2023 guidelines. A dedicated scholar, Dr. Tiwari holds a Ph.D. in French from Jawaharlal Nehru University, where her research explored the visual representation of Indian women in 19th-century French literature. Her M.Phil., also from JNU, examined the portrayal of Indian women in French comics. Dr. Tiwari has presented several research papers at international seminars and symposiums and published in peer-reviewed journals on subjects ranging from the psychoanalysis of French travellers and indologists to the depiction of women in African and Indian contexts within French media. Fluent in French, English, Hindi, Romanian, and Urdu, she is known for her innovative approaches to language pedagogy, creating an inclusive and dynamic learning environment. Her commitment to fostering cross-cultural dialogue is evident in her work both in academia and the broader community, using language as a bridge to connect diverse cultures. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: nisha.tiwarifls@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Dr. Anand Kumar Soni. Role: Assistant Professor  (French). Bio: Assistant Professor (French) Dr. Anand Kumar Soni is an Assistant Professor at the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT-Deemed to be University, specializing in French cinema and translation. He earned his Ph.D. from Banaras Hindu University(BHU) and has a strong academic background, having previously served as an Assistant Professor at Amity University Patna for three years. Dr. Soni has actively participated in several national and international workshops and conferences, contributing to the academic discourse in his field. His research work is well-recognized, with multiple papers published in UGC CARE-listed journals. Passionate about language, culture, and cinema, he continues to inspire students through his teaching and scholarly contributions. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: anand.soniksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Dr. Sukanto Mazumder. Role: Assistant Professor  (Japanese). Bio: Assistant Professor (Japanese) Dr. Sukanto Mazumder is an Assistant Professor of Japanese at the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He is a dedicated academician who was awarded a Ph.D. in Japanese literature from Visva-Bharati, Santiniketan. He holds his M.A. degree in Japanese from the University of Delhi. His research primarily explores the works of famous Japanese writer Kenji Miyazawa, with published papers in international journals and conference proceedings. Prestigious training programs, including the JENESYS initiative in Japan, enrich his academic journey. He completed the “The Japanese Language Teachers” training course conducted by the Ministry of External Affairs of India and the Embassy of Japan in India with the support of The Japan Foundation, from September 12, 2018, to September 16, 2018, at Santiniketan, West Bengal. At present, he is engaged in research on pre-modern Japanese literature. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: sukanto.mazumder@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Ms. Teeju Bhagat. Role: Assistant Professor  ( Spanish ). Bio: Assistant Professor ( Spanish ) Ms. Teeju Bhagat is an Assistant Professor of Spanish in the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, India. She is pursuing her PhD from Centre of Spanish, Portuguese, Italian and Latin American Studies (CSPILAS), Jawaharlal Nehru University, specializing in Hispanic Philology and Literature. She holds a Master of Philosophy (M.Phil.) degree in Spanish Language and Literature, complemented by a Master of Arts and Bachelors of Arts degree in Spanish from the same university. She has done C1 level from Instituto Cervantes, New Delhi. She qualified UGC (NET-JRF) in December, 2018. Ms. Bhagat has been selected to participate in a teacher training course for Spanish as a foreign language at the Centro Internacional del Español of the Universidad de Salamanca (CIEUSAL), Spain in September, 2024. She received Prof. Susnigdha Dey Conference Grant (2022) to present her paper in an international conference.  She worked as a University Teaching Assistant at Jawaharlal Nehru University for two years, where she taught Spanish Language and Literature and also Portuguese certificate course. Moreover, she was empanelled as an Academic Counsellor for Masters of Spanish Language at Indira Gandhi National Open University (IGNOU), and Guest faculty in DSEU (Delhi Skill and Entrepreneurship University). She has book chapters and research articles published in reputed international book publications and in several peer-reviewed international journals. She has also presented several papers in international conferences on Hispanic and Lusophone studies. Her areas of research interest include Comparative Literature, Gender Studies, Decolonial Studies, Popular Culture, Folklore Studies, Migration Studies, Linguistics and Cinema Studies . She is proficient in Hindi, English, Spanish, and Portuguese languages. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: teeju.bhagatksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Mr. Vishant Vikash Sinha. Role: Assistant Professor  (German ). Bio: Assistant Professor ( German ) Mr. Vishant Vikash Sinha is an Assistant Professor of German in the Department of Languages and Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. He is pursuing a PhD in German Studies at Jawaharlal Nehru University, New Delhi specializing in the intersection of verbal and visual narratives, particularly in Heinrich von Kleist’s works. Vishant also holds an M.Phil., M.A., and B.A. in German Studies from the same institution, where he gained valuable experience as a Teaching Assistant. With a strong academic foundation and industry-oriented approach, Vishant has successfully integrated his research into practical applications. His expertise extends to teaching and curriculum development, where he emphasizes industry-relevant skills in German language, literature and cultural studies. At KIIT, he designs and delivers courses that prepare students to learn the language from scratch and engage with the global literary and cultural industries, focusing on contemporary German-speaking regions and their cultural histories. Vishant’s research and academic contributions explore critical themes such as Migration in graphic novels, Intertextuality, Intermediality and Intersection of Mythology & Literature. He has been awarded the Junior Research Fellowship (JRF), Senior Research Fellowship (SRF) and has qualified the National Eligibility Test (NET) for Assistant Professorship, conducted by UGC, Government of India. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: vishant.sinhaksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Ms. Melanie Waser. Role: German Language Teacher & Executive- International Relations Office. Bio: German Language Teacher & Executive- International Relations Office Ms. Melanie Waser is associated with the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University as a German Language Teacher. She is also having the additional responsibility as an Executive of the University’s International Relations Office (IRO). Ms. Waser was born and raised in central Switzerland and completed her Master’s degree in Molecular Life Sciences with focus on biochemistry and chemical biology in 2018 at University of Bern, Switzerland. Following this, she pursued a career in Regulatory Affairs, managing the documentary requirements of medicines for marketing authorisation as well as life cycle management with focus on the Swiss market. Ms. Waser was responsible for the due diligence/regulatory approval of medical drugs and devices that were to be launched in the Swiss Market. Some of her major pharma clients were Bayer, Takeda, Astra Zeneca etc. In 2021, Ms. Waser moved to India with her husband exploring the various languages and cultures of a country very different from Europe. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: melanie.waser@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Mr . Pravin Kumar Gupta. Role: German Language Instructor. Bio: German Language Instructor Mr. Pravin Kumar Gupta is working as a German language Instructor in KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar (Odisha) since August 2014. Along with imparting classes on German language proficiency he also teaches English (Language Lab) as well as Hindi in the University. Prior to his association with KIIT University, he was part of many corporate houses including Caliber Point, Deutsche Bank & S G Analytics. He has also worked as a corporate trainer at Wipro, Hyderabad in 2014 Prof Gupta has studied Advanced Diploma of Proficiency (ADOP) in German language from Osmania University, Hyderabad and B.A. in English from DDU Gorakhpur University, Gorakhpur. Being a student friendly teacher, he has insight into both the corporate as well as academic world. He focuses on activity based, effective learning. During his tenure in KIIT University he has had the fortune of teaching students of various nationalities. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: pravin.guptaksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Mr. Satkar Tripathi. Role: Faculty Associate  (Japanese). Bio: Faculty Associate (Japanese) Mr. Satkar Tripathi is working in the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, as a Faculty Associate in Japanese. He holds a Bachelor’s degree in Japanese from the prestigious Visva-Bharati University, Santiniketan, an institution founded by Noble Laureate Rabindranath Tagore. He further pursued his Master’s from Doon University, Dehradun, renowned for its excellence in foreign language studies. With a passion for promoting language and culture, Mr. Tripathi taught Japanese at the undergraduate level for a year just after completing his Masters, during which he organised various workshops and cultural events to popularize the Japanese language. Additionally, he contributed to the formulation of the NEP 2020 syllabus at Doon University, showcasing his dedication to curriculum development and academic innovation. Mr. Tripathi holds a N3 level certification in the Japanese Language Proficiency Test. His research interests include Translation Studies and Comparative Literature, reflecting his commitment to bridging linguistic and cultural boundaries. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: satkar.tripathifls@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Ms. Upasana Sarangi. Role: Faculty Associate  (English ). Bio: Faculty Associate ( English ) Ms. Upasana Sarangi is a Faculty Associate in English and has been involved in the teaching of Communicative English, Legal English, and English language training. She has presented papers relating to postfeminism, media culture, and decolonial values of literature. She has also worked as a content writer and journalist before initiating her academic journey. Profile: Dr. Gourab Chatterjee. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Assistant Professor Dr. Gourab Chatterjee is an Assistant Professor of English in the School of Languages, KIIT deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, Odisha. He has 8 years of undergraduate and postgraduate level teaching experience. Before joining KIIT he worked as an Assistant Professor of English in Adamas University. Prior to that he served as the Head of the Department in the Department of English and Literary Studies, Brainware University for two years. Dr. Chatterjee pursued his BA, MA and MPhil in Comparative Literature from Jadavpur University and obtained his PhD in Arts from the same University in 2018. He also did a Certificate Course in Swahili Language from the Department of African Studies, Delhi University.Being an avid reader and a researcher in the field of African Literatures, he is one of the founder members of the Centre for Studies in African Literatures and Cultures, Jadavpur University and taught there for nearly three years.He received State Fellowship from the Government of West Bengal and served the Department of Comparative Literature as a research fellow. He also worked as a Junior Research Fellow in the International School of Dravidian Linguistics, Thiruvanthapuram, Kerala. During the time of MPhil, Dr. Chatterjee received the SRTT fellowship offered by the School of Women’s Studies, Jadavpur University. Dr. Chatterjee authored two modules in Project ePathshala, An MHRD (Ministry of Human Resource Development, India) Project under its National Mission on Education through ICT and took part in the Project Bichitra, funded by Ministry of Culture, Government of India, undertaken by the School of Cultural Texts and Records, Jadavpur University as a Project Operator. He presented papers in different international conferences and published book chapters and papers in various reputed journals. Dr. Chatterjee is also a proficient translator and undertook many translation projects. His research area includes Comparative Literature, Cultural Studies, Cross-Cultural Literary Studies, Orature and Literature, Reception Theory, Literary Theory and Literatures of Africa. Profile: Ms. Arannya Bag. Role: Faculty Associate  (Japanese). Bio: Ms. Arannya Bag is working as a Faculty Associate of Japanese language at the Department of Language & Literature, School of Liberal Studies, KIIT Deemed to be University, India. She has qualified Japanese Language Proficiency Test (JLPT) upto N2 level. Her areas of interest in research include Applied Linguistics and its subfields, such as Translation Studies, Language for Specific Purposes (LSP), and Second Language Acquisition of foreign language learners. Profile: Dr. Shipra Gupta. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Assistant Professor Dr. Shipra Gupta is an Assistant Professor of English in the School of Languages, KIIT Deemed to be University, Bhubaneswar, India. She has been teaching undergraduate and postgraduate level students since 2014. Before joining KIIT she worked as a Post-Doctoral Fellow, Centre of Excellence for Translation and Life writing at Rama Devi Women’s University, Bhubaneswar which was funded by the World Bank under the OHEPEE program. Dr. Gupta completed her Masters and M.Phil. in English Literature with a specialization in American Literature and Film Studies from Utkal University, Bhubaneswar. She obtained her Ph.D. Degree from KIIT Deemed to be University and her focus area was film remakes across cultures. She has presented papers on film studies/criticism in national and international conferences. Her research articles have been published in journals and as chapters in edited books that are indexed under Scopus, Springer and UGC. Her research interests include Media Studies, Culture Studies, various forms of Life writing and Trans-cultural Adaptations. Profile: Dr. Tanmoy Putatunda. Role: Assistant Professor & Coordinator. Bio: Assistant Professor & Coordinator Dr. Tanmoy Putatunda is an Assistant Professor of English in the Department of Humanites, KIIT University. He is also a doctoral candidate in the Department of English, Visva-Bharati, Santiniketan. He has a cumulative teaching experience of 6 years in the Postgraduate and Undergraduate. Prior to joining KIIT University, Mr. Putatunda served as the Head of the Department of English Language and Literature, Adamas University, Kolkata. He also taught in Bhairab Ganguly College (PG English), Belghoria, Kolkata, as a guest faculty and worked as an instructor in the Spoken English course conducted by Visva-Bharati. He secured first class in both Undergraduate and Postgraduate course of studies from Department of English, Visva-Bharati.Mr. Putatunda was awarded UGC- Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) in 2013. He had been engaged in a research project undertaken by IIM Kozhikode. Mr. Putatunda has presented papers in national and international conferences and published research papers in prestigious academic journals and books. His research interests include Urban Studies and literary representation of cities, Literary Theories and Criticism, Postcolonial and Postmodern Literatures, Indian Literature in English, Travel Literature, Popular Literature, Cultural Studies, Film Studies, and Literature & Visual Arts. Details: Biography: Assistant Professor & Coordinator Dr. Tanmoy Putatunda is an Assistant Professor of English in the Department of Humanites, KIIT University. He is also a doctoral candidate in the Department of English, Visva-Bharati, Santiniketan. He has a cumulative teaching experience of 6 years in the Postgraduate and Undergraduate. Prior to joining KIIT University, Mr. Putatunda served as the Head of the Department of English Language and Literature, Adamas University, Kolkata. He also taught in Bhairab Ganguly College (PG English), Belghoria, Kolkata, as a guest faculty and worked as an instructor in the Spoken English course conducted by Visva-Bharati. He secured first class in both Undergraduate and Postgraduate course of studies from Department of English, Visva-Bharati.Mr. Putatunda was awarded UGC- Junior Research Fellowship (JRF) in 2013. He had been engaged in a research project undertaken by IIM Kozhikode. Mr. Putatunda has presented papers in national and international conferences and published research papers in prestigious academic journals and books. His research interests include Urban Studies and literary representation of cities, Literary Theories and Criticism, Postcolonial and Postmodern Literatures, Indian Literature in English, Travel Literature, Popular Literature, Cultural Studies, Film Studies, and Literature & Visual Arts.

Profile: Prof. Debanjali Roy. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Assistant Professor Debanjali Roy is an Assistant Professor in the School of Language, KIIT University. She has a cumulative teaching experience of seven years in the Postgraduate and Undergraduate level of studies. Prior to joining KIIT University, she was a faculty member in the Department of English, Adamas University and also served the position of Assistant Dean, Students’ Affairs for a brief period. She was a recipient of T.S. Sterling Scholarship for academic excellence in Undergraduate studies from Presidency College (presently University), Kolkata. Besides M. A. in English Language and Literature from University of Calcutta, she also holds a Post Graduate Diploma in Journalism and Mass Communication from Jadavpur University. She is a pursuing her Doctoral degree from the Department of English, University of Calcutta and has significantly contributed to the field of Applied Linguistics and Literature through her research publications and academic affiliations. Her research and academic interest areas include Applied Linguistics and ELT, Elizabethan Theatre, Romantic Art and Literature, Modern Art and Literature, Popular Fiction and Culture, Film Studies, Creative Writing. Her dedication towards academics received recognition in the form of Professional Scholarships funded by the Regional English Language Office (US Department of State). She was also an awardee of the Travel Grant sponsored by University of Calcutta to Oxford University, UK and the prestigious Erasmus Mundus Teacher Exchange fellowship for the year 2020 funded by the European Union. Ms. Roy is a trained classical dancer and actively coordinates co-curricular activities in academic and professional space. Contact: Phone: Not available, Email: debanjali.royksol@kiit.ac.in. Profile: Dr. Sasmita Kanungo. Role: Assistant Professor. Bio: Assistant Professor Dr. Sasmita Kanungo is an Assistant Professor of English in the Depart of Language, KIIT University, Bhubaneswar. She is pursuing her Ph.D. from Centre for Applied Linguistics and Translation Studies (CALTS), at University of Hyderabad. She has completed her M.A. and M.Phil in Applied Linguistics from University of Hyderabad. She has also done M.A. in English Literature from Ravenshaw University, Cuttack, Odisha. Her research areas are Second Language Acquisition and English Language Teaching. Her academic as well as research interest is in Sociolinguistics, Psycholinguistics, Semantics, Creative Writing and Communicative English. She has contributed to the field of Applied Linguistics through research publications. Also, she has participated and presented papers in Applied Linguistics at many national and international conferences and seminars.
